Sequence Information.Source: Litoria infrafrenata (Giant tree frog) (White-lipped tree frog)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli (MIC=50 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Leuconostoc mesenteroides (MIC=25 µg/ml), Bacillus cereus (MIC=12.5 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=1.5 µg/ml), Pastewella haemolytica (MIC=0.8 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=50 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Wide spectrum antimicrobial peptide. Considered to interact with the outer lipid layer of the bacterial cell, penetrate the bacterial membrane, form ion channels, and ultimately kill the cell.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin parotoid and/or rostral glands.

Literature.Title: The structures of the frenatin peptides from the skin secretion of the giant tree frog Litoria infrafrenata.
Literature.Author: Raftery MJ, Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.
